request.source: The API Key to set as enabled or disabled
request.disabled: Should the API key be set to disabled

/api2/json/disable/{source}/{disabled}.summary: Used to enable or disable an API key. Setting the disabled parameter of an API key to true will prevent its usage.

response.name: Submitted proper noun
response.commonType: Most likely type of the proper noun
response.commonTypeAlt: Second most likely type of the proper noun
response.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, score is not normalized

/api2/json/nameType/{properNoun}.summary: Returns the type of a submitted proper noun. Ex: John Smith = personal name, Namsor = brand name.

response.countryOrigin: Most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
response.countryOriginAlt: Second most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
response.countriesOriginTop: Top 10 most likely countries of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, sorted from most likely to least likely
response.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, score is not normalized
response.topRegionOrigin: Most likely region of origin (alternative classification)
response.probabilityCalibrated: Higher implies a more reliable result, ranges from 0 to 1 (for countryOrigin)
response.probabilityAltCalibrated: Higher implies a more reliable result, ranges from 0 to 1 (for countryOriginAlt)

/api2/json/origin/{firstName}/{lastName}.summary: Returns the most likely country of origin of a first name and a last name. Note that the "Diaspora" endpoint may be better suited for multicultural countries like the U.S.A., Canada, Russia, etc.

request.personalNameFull: Full name (first name and last name) or surname

response.name: The provided full name
response.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, but score is not normalized. Use probabilityCalibrated if available
response.country: Most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
response.countryAlt: Second most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
response.topRegion: Most likely region of origin (alternative classification)
response.subRegion: Most likely sub region of origin
response.countriesTop: Top 10 most likely countries of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, sorted from most likely to least likely
response.probabilityCalibrated: Higher implies a more reliable result, ranges from 0 to 1 (for country)
response.probabilityAltCalibrated: Higher implies a more reliable result, ranges from 0 to 1 (for countryAlt)

/api2/json/country/{personalNameFull}.summary: Returns the most likely geographic context of a full name (first name and last name) or a surname.

response.softwareNameAndVersion: Name and version of the API
response.softwareVersion: Software version, as an array (major, minor and patch)

/api2/json/softwareVersion.summary: Returns the current version of the Namsor software.

softwareVersion.softwareNameAndVersion: Name and version of the API
softwareVersion.softwareVersion: Software version, as an array (major, minor and patch)

classifiers.serving: True if the classifier is serving requests (has reached minimal learning, is not shutting down)
classifiers.learning: True if the classifier is learning
classifiers.shuttingDown: True if the classifier is shutting down
classifiers.probabilityCalibrated: True if the classifier has finished the initial learning and has calibrated probabilities (during initial learning, calibrated probabilities will be equal to -1)

/api2/json/apiStatus.summary: Returns the current version of the Namsor software and the status of the classifiers (API services).

response.serviceGroup: Group the classifier / service belong to
response.costInUnits: Usage cost of the service, in credits

/api2/json/apiServices.summary: Returns a list of the API services (classifiers) and their usage costs in credits.

/api2/json/taxonomyClasses/{classifierNa.summary: Returns a list of the possible enumerators for a given classifier.

subscription.planStarted: Start date of the plan, in UNIX time format
subscription.priorPlanStarted: Datetime when the user subscribed to the prior plan
subscription.planEnded: End date of the plan, in UNIX time format
subscription.taxRate: Applicable tax rate for the plan
subscription.planBaseFeesKey: Current plan key (as in Stripe product)
subscription.planQuota: Total number of credits associated with this plan
subscription.price: Price in the user's preferred currency
subscription.priceOverage: Overaged price in the user's preferred currency
subscription.currencyFactor: For USD, GBP, EUR - the factor is 1

billingPeriod.subscriptionStarted: Subscription start date, in UNIX time format
billingPeriod.periodStarted: Subscription period start date, in UNIX time format
billingPeriod.periodEnded: Subscription end date, in UNIX time format
billingPeriod.stripeCurrentPeriodEnd: End of the current plan in Stripe
billingPeriod.stripeCurrentPeriodStart: Start of the current plan in Stripe
billingPeriod.billingStatus: Status of the current period billing
billingPeriod.usage: Number of credits used so far
billingPeriod.softLimit: Current soft limit for the period
billingPeriod.hardLimit: Current hard limit for the period

response.overageQuantity: Quantity above monthly quota of the current subscritpion, in credits

/api2/json/apiUsage.summary: Returns information on your subscription plan, billing period and current API usage.

apiKey.admin: Does the API Key have admin priviledges
apiKey.vetted: Is the API Key vetted for machine learning
apiKey.learnable: Is the API Key authorised to feed the machine learning
apiKey.anonymized: Is the API Key anonymized (using its SHA-256 digest for logging)
apiKey.partner: Does the API Key have a partnership role
apiKey.striped: Is the API Key associated to a valid Stripe account
apiKey.corporate: Does the API Key have a corporate role
apiKey.disabled: Is the API Key temporarily or permanently disabled

response.createdDateTime: Date of the analysis, in UNIX time format
response.totalUsage: Total cost of the analysis in credits
response.lastFlushedDateTime: Last time the counter was reset, in UNIX time format
response.lastUsedDateTime: Last time the API key was used, in UNIX time format
response.serviceFeaturesUsage: Details regarding usage of special features

/api2/json/apiUsageHistory.summary: Returns the detailed usage history, indicating what services where called and what API key parameters where applied.

response.timeUnit: Unit of time used in the "rowHeaders" field. May vary depending on API usage ("DAY", "WEEK" or "MONTH")
response.periodStart: Start of the reporting period, in UNIX time format
response.periodEnd: End of the reporting period, in UNIX time format
response.totalUsage: Total usage during the current period
response.historyTruncated: Indicates if returned data was truncaded due to size limits
response.data: Aggregated API usage, formated as an array of data points (or array of arrays)
response.colHeaders: Column headers used to link API services to the values in each data point
response.rowHeaders: Row headers used to link a period of time to a data point

/api2/json/apiUsageHistoryAggregate.summary: Returns the aggregated API usage history detailing usage per service. For each data point in the "data" field there is a corresponding row header in the "rowHeaders" field. For each value in a data point in the "data" field there is a corresponding column header in the "colHeaders" field. Ex: To find the period of data[0], lookup rowHeaders[0]. To find the service corresponding to data[0][3], lookup colHeaders[3].

request.source: The API Key to set as learnable or non-learnable
request.learnable: Should the API key be set to learnable

/api2/json/learnable/{source}/{learnable.summary: Used to set the learnable status of an API key. Setting the learnable parameter of an API key to false will prevent the submitted data from feeding the machine learning.

request.source: The API Key to set as learnable/non learnable.
request.learnable: Should the API key be set to learnable

/api2/json/learnable/{source}/{learnable.summary: Activate/deactivate learning from a source. This feature will be implemented soon.

request.source: The API Key to set as anonymized or non-anonymized
request.anonymized: Should the API key be set to anonymized

/api2/json/anonymize/{source}/{anonymize.summary: Activate/deactivate anonymization for a source. This feature will be implemented soon.

request.source: The API Key to set as anonymized or non-anonymized
request.anonymized: Should the API key be set to anonymized

/api2/json/anonymize/{source}/{anonymize.summary: Used to set the anonymized status of an API key. Setting the anonymized parameter of an API key to true will hide the data processed with this API key in the logs by using a SHA-256 digest of the submissions instead.

request.countryIso2: Most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format

response.name: Submitted proper noun
response.commonType: Most likely type of the proper noun
response.commonTypeAlt: Second most likely type of the proper noun
response.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, score is not normalized

/api2/json/nameTypeGeo/{properNoun}/{cou.summary: Returns the type of up to 100 submitted proper nouns using its geographic context. Ex: John Smith = personal name, Namsor = brand name.

response.name: Submitted proper noun
response.commonType: Most likely type of the proper noun
response.commonTypeAlt: Second most likely type of the proper noun
response.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, score is not normalized

/api2/json/nameTypeBatch.summary: Returns the type of up to 100 submitted proper nouns. Ex: John Smith = personal name, Namsor = brand name.

/api2/json/nameTypeGeoBatch.summary: Returns the type of up to 100 submitted proper nouns using their geographic context. Ex: John Smith = personal name, Namsor = brand name.

request.countryIso2From: Country of origin of the sender, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
request.firstNameFrom: First name (or given name) of the sender
request.lastNameFrom: Last name (or family name) of the sender
request.countryIso2To: Country of origin of the receiver, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
request.firstNameTo: First name (or given name) of the receiver
request.lastNameTo: Last name (or family name) of the receiver

FirstLastNameGenderedOut.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, but score is not normalized. Use probabilityCalibrated if available
FirstLastNameGenderedOut.probabilityCalibrated: Higher implies a more reliable result, ranges from 0 to 1

FirstLastNameOriginedOut.countryOrigin: Most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
FirstLastNameOriginedOut.countryOriginAlt: Second most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
FirstLastNameOriginedOut.countriesOriginTop: Top 10 most likely countries of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, sorted from most likely to least likely
FirstLastNameOriginedOut.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, but score is not normalized. Use probabilityCalibrated if available

FirstLastNameOriginedOut.probabilityAltCalibrated: Higher implies a more reliable result, ranges from 0 to 1 (for countryOriginAlt)

FirstLastNameDiasporaedOut.score: Higher implies a more reliable result, but score is not normalized. Use probabilityCalibrated if available
FirstLastNameDiasporaedOut.lifted: Indicates if the output ethnicity is based on machine learning only, or further lifted as a known fact by a country-specific rule
FirstLastNameDiasporaedOut.countryIso2: Most likely country of origin, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
FirstLastNameDiasporaedOut.ethnicitiesTop: Top 10 most likely etchnicities, order from most likely to least likely
FirstLastNameDiasporaedOut.probabilityCalibrated: The calibrated probability for ethnicity to have been guessed correctly. -1 = still calibrating.
FirstLastNameDiasporaedOut.probabilityAltCalibrated: The calibrated probability for ethnicity OR ethnicityAlt to have been guessed correctly. -1 = still calibrating.

/api2/json/corridor/{countryIso2From}/{f.summary: Returns complete analysis of a cross border interactions between two names using their geographic context. The sender is the one who initiated the interaction (from) while the receiver is the one intended to receive the interaction (to).
